div.div: Â Abby Kelley to continue with Distance Learning for the remainder of the school year MORE

div.h6: Abby Kelley to continue with Distance Learning for the remainder of the school year

div.div: Tuesday, April 21, 2020 Governor Baker announced that schools within Massachusetts would remain closed for the rest of the spring. Abby Kelley will continue to follow the District's Distance Learning Plan.

div.p: The missionÂ of the Abby Kelley Foster Charter Public School is to assist parents in their role as primary educators of their children by providing a classical liberal arts education grounded in the great works of Western Civilization and aimed at academic excellence, musical competence, and character formation.
Executive Director's Update February 2020 updating the Abby Kelley Community regarding respiratory illnesses.
Abby Kelley Foster seeks to hire a Director of Finance and Operations, see the full job posting on SchoolSpring.

a.aria-label: Executive Director January 2020 Update, Executive Director January 2020 Update
a.title: Executive Director January 2020 Update

p.br:
Doors open at 8:30 a.m., as busses arriveÂ daily.Â Students arriving afterÂ 8:45 a.m. will be marked tardy.
Â

hr.p:
Parent Pick Up begins at 3:15 p.m. daily. Busses depart at 3:30 p.m.Â Â All students need to be picked up by 3:30 p.m.
Â
To allow enough time for our regular dismissal, should you need to dismiss your student(s) before the end of the day, please do so before 2:15 p.m. on Full Days.

Parent pick up begins at 11:45 a.m. We ask that if you need to dismiss your student(s) prior to this time, please do so by 11:00 a.m.Â Busses will depart at 12:00 p.m.
Â

p.br:
The Middle School day isÂ 7:25 am - 2:10 pm
The building opens atÂ 7:00 am
The main office is open fromÂ 7:00 am-3:30 pm
Half days areÂ 7:25 am â 10:35 am

The High School day isÂ 7:20 am - 2:10 pm
The building is open atÂ 7:00 amÂ and will be locked atÂ 4:00 pm
Half days areÂ 7:20 am - 10:35 am

div.div: Tuesday, April 21, 2020 Governor Baker announced that schools in Massachusetts would remain closed for the remainder of this school year. (the last day of the school year for Abby Kelley is Thursday, June 11th.) Abby Kelley will continue with the Distance Learning Plan we have implemented.

hr.p: Charter schools may not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, creed, sex, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, mental or physical disability, homelessness, age, ancestry, athletic performance, special need, proficiency in the English language or in a foreign language, or academic achievement in admitting students, nor may charter schools set admissions criteria that are intended to discriminate or that have the effect of discriminating on any of these bases.Â M.G.L. c. 71, Â§ 89(l);Â 603 CMR 1.06(1).

AKFCS is committed to providing an accessible website to all people to the maximum
extent possible. If you encounter a problem with accessing any information on this website,
please fill out theÂ Â ADA Complaint FormÂ and let us know.
